text:
Klarman Hall-- it's a space
that sparks imagination.

It has all the great
elements of our classrooms

with little separation
between the teacher, presenter

and the students, audience, and
a remarkable performance space.

We celebrate today
a space that I hope

will be the site of countless
interactions among faculty
and students and staff--

as well as many, many
people from the world
beyond our walls.

This building is a
facility for convening.

That word has come to
have greater import

than we could have imagined
when we broke ground
two and a half years ago.

At a time when our society
is so deeply divided,

it's never been more important
for people to come together

to listen, to open our
minds, and to learn.

And take advantage of this
spectacular facility and all

the talent that comes
with this place, as well.

Because this has the
potential to bring people

together in dialogue
and discussion

at a scaled and leveraged
way that I'm not sure

anybody has been
able to do before.

It is my hope that those
who come to Klarman Hall

will, like Seth, remain
open to listening

to a productive
exchange of ideas--

to learning from
disagreements, and perhaps
grow as a result of them.

This is not easy, but it
is deeply consequential.
It is a path--

not just to truth,
but to community.

We are grateful to the Harvard
Business School for offering us

the opportunity to support
this spectacular new convening
facility.

Creating a powerful forum
where people come together

to engage in the activities and
conversations that will make
better citizens of the world.

Let me once again offer
the Klarmans our heartfelt
thank you.
[APPLAUSE]
